questions.title: What is Java?
questions.description: Java is a high-level programming language developed by Sun Microsystems.

questions.title: How does PostgreSQL handle JSON?
questions.description: PostgreSQL offers robust support for JSON with several functions and operators.

questions.title: What are the benefits of using Spring Boot?
questions.description: Spring Boot simplifies the development of new Spring applications.

questions.title: What is Hibernate?
questions.description: Hibernate is an ORM framework for Java.

questions.title: How to set up a PostgreSQL database?
questions.description: PostgreSQL can be set up using installation packages or via Docker.

questions.title: What is RESTful API?
questions.description: RESTful API uses HTTP requests to perform CRUD operations.

questions.title: What is microservices architecture?
questions.description: Microservices architecture breaks down applications into small services.

questions.title: How does Java handle memory management?
questions.description: Java uses a garbage collector for memory management.

questions.title: What are the features of Java 8?
questions.description: Java 8 introduced lambda expressions, streams, and the new date/time API.

questions.title: How to secure a Spring Boot application?
questions.description: Spring Boot applications can be secured using Spring Security.

answers.content: Java is used for building enterprise-scale applications.
It is platform-independent and secure.
PostgreSQL can store JSON data and allows indexing JSONB data types.
It also has JSON-specific functions like json_each() and json_object_keys().
Spring Boot provides pre-configured starter dependencies.
It also offers embedded servers which simplifies deployment.
Hibernate abstracts database interactions with objects.
It supports lazy loading and caching.
Use the official documentation to set up PostgreSQL.
Docker provides a quick way to set up PostgreSQL.
REST stands for Representational State Transfer.
It uses standard HTTP methods.
Microservices improve modularity and scalability.
Each service can be developed and deployed independently.
Garbage collection helps in automatic memory management.
Different garbage collectors are available in Java.
Lambda expressions enable functional programming.
Streams provide a new way to handle collections.
Spring Security integrates seamlessly with Spring Boot.
Use annotations to configure security settings.
